channel.description: Anyone else insanely pumped for horses!? I can't wait

item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

Phaze One:

The horses do look fun to play with but i’m especially excited about leashes. I’m going to do cruel things to mobs with them…

the days of holding food to attract mobs is the way of the past

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:13, topic:520190”][quote author=Phaze One link=topic=638684.msg4305217#msg4305217 date=1369677485]

Nothing Mojang puts out are really interesting, you need mods if you want cool stuff.

As a sandbox create your own world game, the content is released usually only appeals to a certain ‘type’ of player. If you are into minecraft for technical and/or building aspects then each update is usually very appealing. However if you are looking for tons of content that involves fighting monsters and killing people, then you may be driven away from the vanilla gameplay and into modded minecraft.
[/quote]
Vanilla doesn’t add much technical stuff, or nice building materials. The only good thing they’ve added are stuff that other mods can use. For instance enchantments, anvil and the new redpowder mechanics. Adding a new coal block isn’t interesting. You haven’t much use for coal in vanilla, and it isn’t a very good looking block either.

Mods give me lots of fun stuff from every aspect.

Davidi2: True, I’m not seeing what is so appealing with alpha/beta. If you don’t like some of the new additions you can easily mod them out.[/quote]

You and I both, that’s why i have been playing feed the beast rather than vanilla. But that is just because I really get into the technical stuff so anything regarding gregtech/ic2/redpower etc really appeals to me.

On a different note to head to a different side, I do agree that mojang do need to broaden their horizons with adding more aspects to the game to appeal to a broader audience.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

I tried Feed the Beast once but there was soooo many new things that I had no idea what I should be doing and making. It was just tons of shit thrown at me at once and I really didn’t know what to do. The only thing I was trying for was a quarry to mine for me lol

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Phaze One, post:11, topic:520190”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=638684.msg4305174#msg4305174 date=1369673300]
Nothing Mojang puts out are really interesting, you need mods if you want cool stuff.
[/quote]

As a sandbox create your own world game, the content is released usually only appeals to a certain ‘type’ of player. If you are into minecraft for technical and/or building aspects then each update is usually very appealing. However if you are looking for tons of content that involves fighting monsters and killing people, then you may be driven away from the vanilla gameplay and into modded minecraft.[/quote]
Vanilla doesn’t add much technical stuff, or nice building materials. The only good thing they’ve added are stuff that other mods can use. For instance enchantments, anvil and the new redpowder mechanics. Adding a new coal block isn’t interesting. You haven’t much use for coal in vanilla, and it isn’t a very good looking block either.

Mods give me lots of fun stuff from every aspect.

Davidi2: True, I’m not seeing what is so appealing with alpha/beta. If you don’t like some of the new additions you can easily mod them out.

EDIT: Mojang should have worked at better integration with mods, and not break every mod for every update.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“enzo42, post:10, topic:520190”]I honestly think minecraft alpha/beta was the best.[/quote]This has nothing to do with the content though. That’s just because everything was so amazing back then because it was new and we were so excited for it.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

Bowser jr:

Nothing Mojang puts out are really interesting, you need mods if you want cool stuff.

As a sandbox create your own world game, the content is released usually only appeals to a certain ‘type’ of player. If you are into minecraft for technical and/or building aspects then each update is usually very appealing. However if you are looking for tons of content that involves fighting monsters and killing people, then you may be driven away from the vanilla gameplay and into modded minecraft.

item.dc:creator: @enzo42 enzo42
item.description:
@enzo42 wrote:

I honestly think minecraft alpha/beta was the best.

Horses sound alright I guess though.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

They need to add more depth to the game. That’s what minecraft lacks right now, especially in multiplayer survival. In creative or whatever it’s just about building and that’s fine (but that could still use more depth).

I’m talking about things like industrialcraft, forestry, etc. Those are all great mods that add a lot of end-game content for Minecraft so it doesn’t get boring.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

Travas:

Can you really? I thought they were only possible to put on horses and mules. This changes everything… :rolleyes:

Yeah I was so surprised I could too. I put a chicken on a fence post just like I did a horse.
